It is characterized by its slender, elongated leaves that are often covered in a dense layer of fine hairs, which help to reduce water loss in its harsh environment. The plant produces small, clustered inflorescences with pale yellow flowers that bloom during the short growing season. Due to habitat loss and limited distribution, Microtatorchis taenioides is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
